title: The Accessible Arctic
brief_description: Convincing evidence of the growing advance of industry and settlement in the Canadian far north. New roads, railways and airfields have brought the once isolated northern communities into the mainstream of Canadian life and progress. Explains how this is being done and shows some of the people who are doing it. Among these are Indian and Eskimo graduates of the new trade schools.
